about.title: About
about.content:
About

Hello and welcome to my Website! I currently study Computer Science in the University of Brasilia in Brazil. I love programming and I spend most of my time doing it. I have already made tons of small aplications for myself, but only recently I built up enough knowledge to develop commercial level Apps.

I really like the Objective-C language, and it is the language I currently know the most. I also know a lot of Java and much of C and PHP. I can write something in C#, VB.NET and Ruby. I have already used some other languages, but they already fell in the realms of oblivion inside my brain.

Experiments

In my spare time I like to work on coding experiments. Some become fully-fledged apps, others die right away. Some others are just too simple to become a product. Some of the latter will be posted in the list below.

  • Voyagers Now â€“ September 2013

    In September 2013, NASA announced that the Voyager 1 probe, launched in 1977, has passed the heliopause. This event caused some commotion on the internet and I, being a space geek, decided to create a simple hot site displaying how far both voyagers are from us. I used, with the propper permission, a JS script found in the NASA JPL website. The result is a simple diagram displaying the relative distance of the Voyager probes — and the planets — from the Earth and the Sun.

If you wish to send me a message, please contact me clicking the button below.

Thank you for your visit and have a nice day!

Contact Me
